result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerald W. Gould was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail with Huber for work, medical or treatment if otherwise eligible.

COURT ORDERS:  90 days MCJ w/Huber for work, medical or treatment if otherwise eligible, CC, credit for 3 days.

AMENDED Absolute sobriety. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for Day report. Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. No possession of controlled substances unless they are prescribed and they are taken according to prescription.
